episodeTitle: In Front of the Execution Platform! The Way to Ace Has Opened!!
description: During the intense battle at Marineford, Whitebeard orders his forces to clear a path for Luffy to reach Ace's execution platform. Inazuma uses the Choki Choki no Mi to create a bridge leading directly to the scaffold, while the New World Captains hold back the Marine Vice Admirals. However, Garp intercepts Luffy before he can reach Ace, declaring that Luffy must defeat him to save his brother.

events.title: Reactions to Luffy's Conqueror's Haki
events.description: Following Luffy's unconscious display of Conqueror's Haki, various characters react with shock and recognition. Fossa confirms that Luffy used the same type of Haki as Whitebeard and Shanks. Garp reveals he suspected Luffy was born with this power, while Ace acknowledges his brother also possesses it.
events.significance: Establishes Luffy as one of the rare individuals with Conqueror's Haki, placing him among the most powerful figures in the One Piece world and confirming his potential as a future great pirate.

quotes.text: Luffy used Haki, just like Whitebeard and Shanks.
quotes.speaker: Fossa
quotes.context: Recognizing Luffy's power after witnessing the Conqueror's Haki burst

quotes.text: Luffy was born with it, as I had thought.
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Garp's acknowledgment of Luffy's innate power

quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace's realization that his brother possesses Conqueror's Haki

events.title: Whitebeard Orders Support for Luffy
events.description: Recognizing Luffy's determination and potential after witnessing his Conqueror's Haki, Whitebeard commands his entire crew and allied forces to clear a path for Luffy to reach the execution platform. This strategic decision shifts the focus of the battle to support Luffy's rescue attempt.
events.significance: Demonstrates Whitebeard's tactical brilliance and his acknowledgment of Luffy as a worthy successor to the new generation. This order unifies all allied forces behind Luffy's goal.

quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard's command to his entire crew to support Luffy's advance

events.title: New World Captains vs Marine Vice Admirals
events.description: The New World pirate captains allied with Whitebeard engage the Marine Vice Admirals in intense combat. This coordinated assault creates diversions and clears obstacles, allowing other pirates to forge a path toward the execution platform for Luffy.
events.significance: Showcases the strength of Whitebeard's allies and the desperation of the rescue attempt. The Vice Admirals represent the Marine's elite forces, making this confrontation crucial to the battle's outcome.

events.title: Inazuma Emerges from Ivankov's Hair
events.description: Inazuma, a member of the Revolutionary Army and officer of Emporio Ivankov, reappears after having been hidden in Ivankov's massive hair. Their sudden appearance surprises both allies and enemies on the battlefield.
events.significance: Introduces Inazuma's presence in the Marineford battle and sets up their crucial role in helping Luffy reach the execution platform.

events.title: Inazuma Creates Bridge with Choki Choki no Mi
events.description: Inazuma uses their Choki Choki no Mi (Snip-Snip Fruit) Devil Fruit powers to cut and manipulate the solid ground of Marineford as if it were paper. They fold the stone and earth to create a bridge that leads directly to the execution scaffold, bypassing the chaotic battlefield below.
events.significance: Demonstrates the creative and strategic use of Devil Fruit powers in combat. This bridge becomes the critical path for Luffy to reach Ace, representing the allies' best chance at rescue.

events.title: Luffy Advances on Inazuma's Bridge
events.description: With the bridge created by Inazuma, Luffy charges toward the execution platform where Ace is held. The path is clear and direct, giving Luffy his best opportunity yet to reach his brother. The tension escalates as Luffy gets closer to his goal.
events.significance: Represents the climax of Luffy's desperate push through the battlefield. After fighting through countless Marines and obstacles, Luffy finally has a clear path to Ace.

events.title: Garp Intercepts Luffy
events.description: As Luffy nears the execution platform, his grandfather Garp suddenly appears, blocking his path. Standing as the final obstacle between Luffy and Ace, Garp takes a defensive stance on the bridge. His expression shows the internal conflict between his duty as a Marine and his love for his grandsons.
events.significance: Creates one of the most emotionally charged confrontations in the series, forcing Garp to choose between his Marine duty and his family. This moment represents the personal cost of the war and sets up a critical father-grandson conflict.

quotes.text: If you want to get past me, then it'll be over my dead body!
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Garp's declaration as he blocks Luffy's path to Ace

events.title: Garp's Conflicted Position Revealed
events.description: Garp declares that Luffy must defeat him to save Ace, openly acknowledging the impossible position he's in. As both a Marine hero and grandfather to both Luffy and Ace, Garp's statement reveals the depth of his internal struggle between duty and family love.
events.significance: Highlights the tragic nature of the Marineford War, where family ties are torn apart by larger conflicts. Garp's position symbolizes the personal sacrifices demanded by justice and duty.

events.title: Vice Admiral Doberman Comments on Luffy's Heritage
events.description: Vice Admiral Doberman notes that Luffy's possession of Conqueror's Haki is not surprising given that he is the son of Revolutionary Dragon. This comment highlights how Luffy's lineage and heritage are becoming more widely known among Marine leadership.
events.significance: Reinforces the connection between Luffy's abilities and his bloodline, suggesting that his power may be partially inherited. Also shows that the Marines are aware of Luffy's dangerous heritage.

events.title: Ivankov Notes Luffy's Unconscious Use of Haki
events.description: Emporio Ivankov observes that Luffy is not aware that he is using Conqueror's Haki and therefore is not yet ready to properly control this power. This comment explains why Luffy's Haki manifested unconsciously and hints at his future potential once he learns to control it.
events.significance: Establishes that Luffy has the rare talent but lacks training and conscious control. This sets up his future development and training in using Haki deliberately.

themes.description: The episode explores the conflict between familial bonds and professional duty through Garp's impossible position. As a Marine hero, he must uphold justice, but as a grandfather, he loves both Luffy and Ace.
themes.symbolism: Garp blocking the bridge represents the insurmountable barrier that duty and obligation can place between family members.

themes.description: Multiple characters comment on Luffy's Conqueror's Haki being connected to his heritage as Dragon's son and his connection to powerful figures like Shanks and Whitebeard.
themes.symbolism: The manifestation of Conqueror's Haki symbolizes the passing of power and will from one generation to the next.

themes.description: Whitebeard's pirates and allies sacrifice themselves to clear a path for Luffy, showing their willingness to give everything for the chance to save Ace.
themes.symbolism: Inazuma's bridge represents the collective effort and sacrifice of many creating a path for one person to succeed.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's unconscious use of Conqueror's Haki reveals his hidden potential and places him among the elite. His desperate push toward Ace shows his unwavering determination despite the odds.

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 479 corresponds to portions of Chapters 570-571 of the manga. The anime extended some battle scenes and character reactions for pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first major appearance of Inazuma's Choki Choki no Mi abilities in the Marineford War.

The opening song 'One day' by THE ROOTLESS was specifically written to reflect the somber tone of the Marineford Arc, with over twenty rewrites to arrive at the message of 'protecting the things that are important to me'.
Episode 479 aired on December 12, 2010 in Japan, but was simulcast in the US on December 11, 2010, demonstrating the international reach of the Marineford Arc's popularity.
Kinryu Arimoto, who voiced Whitebeard in this episode, passed away on February 1, 2019 at age 78 after battling esophageal cancer.
